featured.text: While early zoos put emphasis on displaying as many unusual creatures as possible, most modern zoos now focus on conservation and education.
According to the passage, which of the following statements is true? (A) Different dogs display strengths in different intelligences.
Through a projector, this attractive radio-alarm-clock is able to display the time onto a wall, ceiling, or anywhere __23__.
An open display of ______ behavior between men and women, such as hugging and kissing, is not allowed in some conservative societies.
The word “prom” was first used in the 1890s, referring to formal dances in which the guests of a party would display their fashions and dancing skills during the evening’s grand march.

other.text: Posters of the local rock band were displayed in store windows to promote the sale of their _____ tickets.
Installed in Detroit in 1920, Potts’ three-color system allowed for the added signal “proceed with caution” to be displayed.
Do you have a finer one? (A) content (B) display (C) extent (D) texture 11.

definition.en_def: To show or present something for others to see.
definition.example: The museum will display ancient artifacts next month.
